article_title: Poland Remains Reserved on Euro Adoption, Says Finance Minister
article_text:
WARSAW—Poland remains reserved about adopting the euro, its finance minister said in an interview Tuesday, despite suggestions that euro-zone membership could offer added security amid concerns about potential Russian aggression.

Mateusz Szczurek said Tuesday that Poland would consider joining the European single-currency area when the country thinks the move will benefit the economy and won't threaten its financial stability.

article_metadata.article.origheadline: Poland Remains Reserved on Euro Adoption, Says Finance Minister

article_summary:
WARSAW—Poland remains reserved about adopting the euro, its finance minister said in an interview Tuesday, despite suggestions that euro-zone membership could offer added security amid concerns about potential Russian aggression.
Mateusz Szczurek said Tuesday that Poland would consider joining the European single-currency area when the country thinks the move will benefit the economy and won't threaten its financial stability.
